s.text: I don't follow pop music much these days, but the genres that are most interesting to me in a larger cultural and political sense are techno and hip-hop.
A terrible sense of public relations, I certainly agree with you there, but blaming the Clinton spin machine for that insanely prurient report is something of a stretch.

By a functioning left I mean among other things a left with ideas, a left whose advocates can put forward an analysis of what's wrong with the restructuring of the economy and the repressiveness of the culture, rather than avoid looking at the quality of their own lives via sentimental moralizing about what Neil Strauss' Springsteen review actually refers to as the "poor huddled masses."
I don't see any particular reason to vote for Gore, who is fundamentally conservative economically and socially, as well as married to one of our great anti-popular-culture pests.
